info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHEASTERN DEARBORN, NORTHEASTERN SWITZERLAND AND CENTRAL BOONE COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 8 miles northwest of Florence, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Rising Sun, Oakbrook, Burlington, Union, Dillsboro, Shawnee, Wilmington, French, Hartford, Fairview, Center Square, Aberdeen, Idlewild, Big Bone Lick, Waterloo and Markland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
